info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 2:52AM CDT until March 29 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations around a light glaze. For the Ice Storm Warning, significant icing expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations up to two inches and ice accumulations between one quarter and one half of an inch.
* WHERE...Price County.
* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM CDT this morning. For the Ice Storm Warning, from 7 PM this evening to 7 PM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Significant ice accumulation on power lines and tree limbs may cause widespread and long-lasting power outages. Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction:
Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Call 511 or visit www.511wi.gov for Wisconsin road information.
Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Call 511 or visit www.511wi.gov for Wisconsin road information.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM CDT SUNDAY
